value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JlUfz18cx_w" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop

value.title: Power BI App Navigation
value.excerpt: See how to create and use App Navigation in Power BI. You can control the navigation area when publishing Power BI Apps.  Even include external content with your apps!  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba --

value.title: Power BI Drillthrough Updates
value.excerpt: Did you know there were Power BI drillthrough updates? In this video, Patrick looks at the drillthrough updates in Power BI Desktop. This includes Keep All Filters which will pass the filters on your parent page to the drillthrough page.   LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oTjI5ZBQUhM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI for report consumers and end users (2021)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers, or end users. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  📢 Become a member:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cZsQj1WFkGE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/SQ7ufcRayYY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Service Principals 101
value.excerpt: Service principals can be very useful when working with Power BI. From Power BI Embedded, to API and PowerShell. Adam breaks down how to get going with Power BI service principals.  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the

value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. Different options exist, such as Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services or models hosted in the Power BI service.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Refresh your data in Power BI WITHOUT a user???
value.excerpt: Can a Power BI Dataset be setup to refresh without an actual user? It would be great from an automation perspective and to avoid being tied to someone specific. Adam digs in.  Service Principal Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1SO19uik1rw  Add-DataGatewayClusterUser (DataGateway CMDLET - Add to
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/lfP6ygindSU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7d2qMoTPCIM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Unboxing Tabular Editor 3 | Reaction Video
value.excerpt: It's here! Patrick does a reaction video when using Tabular Editor 3 for the first time with Power BI. To say he's excited is an understatement. Watch him take the wrapping off of Tabular Editor.  Tabular Editor: https://tabulareditor.com/  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)
value.excerpt: Just an end user of Power BI? Consuming reports and not authoring at all? Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports. Jump in and get familiar with reports in Power BI!  Reports in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-reports  View a report in the Power BI service
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TAsUb93r2tg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y88s8Vra_1g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Let's dig into the Power BI gateway and Single Sign-On (SSO) using Kerberos!  This can be used for both DirectQuery and refreshing a Power BI dataset.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-sso-overview  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

images.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/z14DV4_Liw4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/SlQJaryCLy4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups. Then any user (within the Group you provided Access to) can click "Get Apps" to consume your App - which comprises the Dashboards,

value.title: Power BI Hyperlink Icons! Make Your HTML Links Look Pretty 🦋
value.excerpt: Using HTML or URL Links in your reports can be really powerful. But these can sometimes look ugly (e.g. for long URLs). Learn how you can pretty up your reports by using a URL Icon instead.  ================================ 👉 FREE Power BI Step-by-Step Tutorial http://web.learnpowerbi.com/tutorial 👉

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Get Data from Multiple Excel Files with Different Sheet Names into Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to use Get Data from Folder in Power BI is a very useful option. However, if your sheet names are different in the list of Excel files, then you will face a problem. In this video, I’ll explain a method you can use that works regardless of the sheet names. Download the sample files from my
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JZSdAvGAq_E" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
